result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Curtis Julka)
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Curtis Julka)

10:05 AM Defendant NICK F MORELAND in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes def has filed for petition of court appointed attorney. Statement by defendant, does not qualify for public defender and has contacted three attorneys and cannot afford them. Court questions defendant what he can pay towards an attorney if the Court appoints one. Statement by defendant, can pay $200.00 every two weeks. Court orders defendant to pay $200 a month for court appointed attorney starting September 1, 2022. Court date to be set once counsel is appointed.

Court adjourned at 10:07 AM

11:17 AM Defendant NICK F MORELAND in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant submitted a form for court appointed counsel. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant regarding the two attorney's he contacted. Court questions defendant what he can pay towards court appointed if he appointed counsel. Statement by defendant can pay $100 every two weeks. Defendant to specifically say what Atty Eric Johsnon is requesting as retainer. Court sets for Status of Counsel on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:18 AM

9:31 AM Defendant NICK F MORELAND in court.  Atty Michael Kapelis appears with defendant. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant does not qualify but will make a courtesy appearance. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint, waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim- MM or the residence. No unsupervised contact with any minors. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
